item.value: Extended by Panel component:
Event will be fired on current route change
event will be triggered right before swipe back animation to previous page when you release it
Event will be triggered right before swipe back animation to previous page when you release it
Event will be triggered during swipe back move
Router will fire the following DOM events for swipe back pages:
Router has a lot of useful events.
will load "some-page" to main view
previous pages history will be cleared after reloading/navigate to the specified route
load new page and remove all previous pages from history and DOM
replace the previous page in history with the new one from route
replace the current page with the new one from route
object with matching route from available routes
Object with router initialization parameters
Event will be triggered on view initialization
View's initialized router instance
Enable/disable opacity animation during swipe back action. You can disable it to improve performance. For iOS theme

When enabled will extract dynamic navbar HTML element from page element and put it as a child of Views element. It improves dynamic navbar transition appearance, but in case you need dynamic navbar to be always as a page's child, then disable this parameter
Enables dynamic navbar for iOS theme
Scrollable page content
Your main view, should have "view-main" class

p Note, that Framework7 ES modules are in ES-next syntax, so don't forget to enable/configure your Babel/Buble to transpile them as well, as well as template7, dom7 and ssr-window modules that used as dependencies.
In addition to default export it has named export for Template7, Dom7, Request, Device, Utils and Support libraries:
Install F7 Components
Import additional components
Framework7 can also be imported as an ES-next module:
From the downloaded Core package we will need files from css and js folders
starter app templates
It is recommended to use Kitchen Sink as a reference during development.
Framework7 Kitchen Sink is a great place to get started, it has a lot of examples for all Framework7 components and covers most of aspects.
